page.title: 01PART OF WAREHAM FOREST
page.content: To the south-east of the block is the RAC Tank Training Range attached to Bovington Camp. The terrain is mainly heathland with large open spaces of sandy soil. The whole area is bery isolated with very few inhabitants. In the north-east sector there is a trout farm where fish are artificially reared for the table. The remainder of the area is mainly covered by pine forest form which are cut large quantities of pit props. Around these woodlands are smaller areas of deciduous trees - mainly oak and beech. There is a Wessex Water Authority reservoir in the north of the block which provides water for the Winfrith Atomic Energy Establishment. Clouds Hill Cottage, which belonged to "Lawrence of Arabia" is now owned by the National Trust and can be found in the southern part of this block.
